answers.answer: If you have a fever, the migraine lasts more than a few hours, or you get blurred vision, you should consult your doctor.
I would.call your doctor to make sure you don't have preeclampsia. Does Tylenol give you any relief? And how is your blood pressure?
Ive taken it but it makes no difference and My blood pressure has been fine at previous MW appointments if it was pre eclampsia wouldnt i have swelling?
Ur iron is probably low... U should get checked

Yes but there are different stages of it. My doctor, for instance, says I have mild pre e but I don't have blurry vision or headaches and only some swelling and I'm only spilling a small amount of protein. I would still call the doctor, it's better to be safe than sorry.
I will talk to my MW about it tomorrow and see what she says, thanks for your help and good luck with your pregnancy :)

I feel that way after standing up too long.. I'm 28 weeks ... I start having a cold sweat and feeling very faint ... Best thing I can tell you to do is rest bc my doctor just told me its normal.... And wasn't much help... I have felt this was since about 5 weeks I just think pregnancy isn't my thing ..but I wouldnt want to change it for the world I love my little girl so much already and couldnt imagine my life without her!
thats how I am to. if I stand too long I feel like im gunna pass out n I get hot. I had to quit my job at 7 weeks because I was on my feet 8 hours a day.

question: Ive been getting migranes for about 10 days accompained by feeling weak and faint i had the same today but this time i started sweating and shaking that i couldnt stop and just didnt feel right atal- im not overweight or anything and eat/drink normally dont no what this could be?
title: Migranes at 24 weeks?
